data.headline: Nasdaq gains 1.35% and Russell 2000 rises 1.19%, outpacing S&P 500 and Dow in mid-session trading
bullets: Nvidia surges on expanded multi-year AI chip infrastructure partnership with Meta, lifting chip and software stocks
Analog Devices rallies on strong Q2 guidance, with Cadence, Synopsys, Palantir, and Amazon also advancing
Apple climbs on reports of accelerated AI-wearables development
Wingstop, Garmin, Moderna, and MSG Sports move higher, with MSG Sports boosted by planned Knicks/Rangers split
Palo Alto Networks and Genuine Parts lag broader market gains
Stronger-than-expected industrial production and durable goods data (durables output +0.8%) support risk appetite
January housing starts jump 6.2% to 1.404 million, further bolstering sentiment
Treasury yields hover near multi-week lows, with a firm dollar and gold above $4,900
Traders await 2 p.m. ET FOMC minutes for rate path clues and monitor AI investment headlines, including Elon Muskâ€™s xAI securing $3 billion in Saudi-backed funding
